Container.Name: Playmaker
Container.Overview: NoMore201/playmaker[br][br] Playmaker is a fdroid repository manager.[br][br] This lets you download/update apps from the play store using your google account and configure repository with app you download.[br][br] After you setup the server, repository will be available at the address http(s)://localhost/fdroid.[br][br] You can start downloading apps from play store.[br][br] Server uses googleplay-api library, which is the python equivalent of the Java play-store-api library used by YalpStore.[br][br] See this URL for device codes: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/NoMore201/googleplay-api/master/gpapi/device.properties[br] Remove HTTPS cert and key fields if you will not be using SSL.[br][br] Features:[br][br] * Download apks from google play store to your collection. Update them or delete if they are not needed anymore.[br][br] * Manage the fdroid repository. You can update it manually, as you add/remove apks to your collection.[br][br] * Non-blocking UI, you can browse the collection or search for an app while the server is updating the fdroid repository.[br][br] * Responsive UI, usable also from a mobile device[br][br] [span style=\'color: #E80000;\']DO THIS BEFORE DEPLOYING THE TEMPLATE[br][br] [/span] create a /mnt/user/playmaker directory.[br] then, chown -R 999:999 /mnt/user/playmaker[br] unRAID Example:[br] docker run -d --restart=always --net=bridge --name playmaker -p 5000:5000 -v /mnt/disks/DataDisk/data/fdroid:/data/fdroid -e PGID=100 -e PUID=99 nomore201/playmaker
